[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Move Integration] [Stack Overflow] Can deeply nested multiplication calls cause Move VM stack overflow before hitting memory limits, bypassing security controls? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Move Integration] [Bytecode Injection] Can malicious Move bytecode inject invalid calls to mul_internal with crafted arguments that bypass Move verifier checks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Handles] [Handle Collision] Can two different AlgebraContext sessions generate colliding handles, allowing cross-session element access? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Handles] [Handle Prediction] Are handles predictable (sequential counter), allowing attackers to guess valid handles and access elements they shouldn't have access to? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Handles] [Handle Lifetime] After a transaction completes, are handles properly invalidated, or can they be reused in subsequent transactions causing state pollution? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Handles] [Handle Overflow] When the handle counter reaches usize::MAX, does it overflow to 0 causing handle collisions and security breaches? (Medium)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Handles] [Handle Type Confusion] Can an attacker obtain a handle from one operation (e.g., deserialization) and use it in mul_internal with a different type, bypassing type safety? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Concurrency] [Parallel Transaction Race] In Block-STM parallel execution, can two transactions simultaneously call mul_internal on the same AlgebraContext causing data races in objs vector? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Concurrency] [Read-Write Conflict] Can mul_internal's read of element_1/element_2 and write of new_element conflict in parallel execution, causing incorrect validation and rollback? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Concurrency] [Memory Limit Race] Can parallel transactions race on bytes_used updates, bypassing the 1MB memory limit by allocating simultaneously? (High)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Concurrency] [Handle Race] Can concurrent handle generation in parallel transactions produce duplicate handles, causing element overwrites and state corruption? (Critical)

[File: aptos-move/framework/src/natives/cryptography/algebra/arithmetics/mul.rs] [Concurrency] [Rc Thread Safety] Are Rc pointers in AlgebraContext.objs thread-safe for parallel execution, or should they be Arc for concurrent access? (Critical)
